channel.title: Projects on Joseph McGrath
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Joseph McGrath

item.title: RowTracker
item.description: The RowTracker is a device to collect data from the movements of an oar and return it via Bluetooth for stroke analysis on a mobile device.

item.title: Open Source Iris PAD
item.description: As my senior thesis at the University of Notre Dame, I created the first open source presentation attack detection (PAD) solution to distinguish between authentic irises and irises with textured contact lenses.

item.title: Road Scene Segmentation
item.description: In this project, road scene segmentation was implemented on multiple levels using Python.

item.title: Microprocessor Design
item.description: As a part of the microelectronics coursework module at the University of Oxford, I worked with a team of three others to design an 8-bit microprocessor.

item.title: Lego Football
item.description: In this project, the objective was to enable a Lego NXT robot to stand on two wheels and move to play soccer.

item.title: Etch-a-Sketch
item.description: s a final project for the logic design class I took in the Spring 2017 semester, my group and I designed an Etch-a-Sketch program in Verilog.

item.title: Dispersion Calculator
item.description: This program, written in MATLAB, can be used to calculate the group delay dispersion (GDD) introduced by a set of two prisms.

item.title: Car Diagnostics
item.description: The final product is a vehicle diagnostic that will oversee the systems of a car and ensure that it is working properly.

item.title: Railgun
item.description: A railgun is a weapon currently being researched by the United States Navy that uses an electrical current to create a magnetic field that launches a projectile.
